meanings.sent1: The apocryphal tale was hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: She heard an apocryphal story about a ghost in the old house.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphal excuse for not doing homework was that the dog ate it.
meanings.sent4: His promises were as apocryphal as a mirage in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The apocryphal painting fooled many art experts.

meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed listening to the apocryphal about a magical unicorn.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied an ancient apocryphal found in the archives.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphal told by the comedian had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like an apocryphal, full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The campfire was lit up with an apocryphal of a haunted forest.

meanings.sent1: The library had a rare apocryphal on ancient myths.
meanings.sent2: He found an apocryphal in the bookstore that intrigued him.
meanings.sent3: The apocryphal on aliens was a bestseller among conspiracy theorists.
meanings.sent4: In her collection, she had an apocryphal that claimed to reveal hidden secrets.
meanings.sent5: The apocryphal on lost civilizations sparked his imagination.
